Name: Adventure
Description: Stories Centered On Exciting Journeys, Exploration, And High‑Stakes Challenges.

Name: Adult
Description: Books Written For Mature Readers, Often Exploring Complex Emotional Or Social Themes.

Name: Biography
Description: A Factual Account Of A Real Person's Life, Written By SomeOne Else.

Name: Children
Description: Books Written For Young Readers, Focusing On Simple Language And Age‑Appropriate Themes.

Name: Classic
Description: TimeLess Works Recognized For Lasting Cultural, Artistic, Or Literary Value.

Name: Comedy
Description: Light‑Hearted Stories Designed To Amuse, Entertain, And Evoke Laughter.

Name: Contemporary
Description: Fiction Set In The Present Day, Reflecting Modern Life And Issues.

Name: Crime
Description: Stories Involving Criminal Acts, Investigations, And The Pursuit Of Justice.

Name: Drama
Description: Emotion‑Driven Narratives Focused On Realistic Characters And Intense Conflicts.

Name: Dystopian
Description: Stories Set In Oppressive Or NightMarish Societies, Often Exploring Political Or Social Themes.

Name: Fantasy
Description: Fiction Featuring Magical Systems, Mythical Creatures, Or Entirely Invented Worlds.

Name: Fiction
Description: Narrative Writing Based On Imagination Rather Than Factual Events.

Name: Graphic
Description: Stories Told Through Illustrated Panels, Combining ArtWork With Narrative Text.

Name: Historical
Description: Stories Or Texts Focused On Past Eras, Cultures, Or Events.

Name: Horror
Description: Fiction Intended To Evoke Fear, Dread, Or PsychoLogical UnEase.

Name: Humor
Description: Books Focused On Wit, Satire, And Comedic StoryTelling.

Name: Literary
Description: Narratives Emphasizing Depth, Style, And Thematic Exploration.

Name: MetaPhysic
Description: Books Exploring The Fundamental Nature Of Reality, Existence, Consciousness, And Universal Principles.

Name: Memoir
Description: A Personal, First‑Person Account Of Specific Experiences Or Periods In An Author's Life.

Name: Mystery
Description: Stories Centered On Solving Puzzles, Crimes, Or UnExplained Events.

Name: Nonfiction
Description: Informational Or Factual Writing Based On Real Events, People, Or Concepts.

Name: Paranormal
Description: Fiction Involving Supernatural Elements Such As Ghosts, Psychic Powers, Or UnExplained Phenomena.

Name: Philosophy
Description: Books Exploring Ideas About Existence, Ethics, Knowledge, And Human Nature.

Name: Poetry
Description: Literary Works Written In Verse, Emphasizing Rhythm, Imagery, And Emotional Expression.

Name: Psychological
Description: Stories Or Texts Focused On The Inner Workings Of The Mind, Emotion, End Behavior.

Name: Religious
Description: Books Exploring Inner Growth, Consciousness, Meaning, And The Connection Between Self And The Universe.

Name: Romance
Description: Stories Focused On RelationShips, Emotional Bonds, And Romantic Love.

Name: Science
Description: Books Explaining Scientific Principles, Discoveries, And The Natural World Through Factual, Research‑Based Content.

Name: Self‑Help
Description: Books Offering Guidance For Personal Growth, Habits, Mindset, Or Emotional Well‑Being.

Name: Short
Description: Stories Or Texts That Are Brief, Focusing On A Single Idea, Moment, Or Character Arc.

Name: Story
Description: Narrative Works Presenting Events, Characters, And Themes In Structured Form.

Name: Thriller
Description: Fast‑Paced Stories Built On Tension, Danger, And High Emotional Stakes.

Name: Travel
Description: Books Describing Journeys, Cultures, And Experiences From Around The World.

Name: Urban
Description: Stories Set In Modern City Environments, Often Blending Realism With Other Thematic Elements.

Name: Young
Description: Books Aimed At Younger Audiences, Focusing On Themes Of Growth And Identity.
